article.headline: Biden calls for national mask mandate, saying it would save 40,000 lives over 3 months
article.body: Joe Biden on Thursday called for a national mask mandate to limit the spread of COVID-19, stepping up his rhetoric on the issue after criticizing President Donald Trump’s stance earlier this summer. “Every single American should be wearing a mask when they’re outside for the next three months at a minimum,” the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee said in a brief appearance before reporters in Wilmington, Del. “Every governor should mandate mandatory mask-wearing. The estimates by the experts are it’ll save over 40,000 lives in the next three months.” The former vice president in June had said the “very top” of government should call for mask wearing, in a criticism of Trump’s reluctance in donning personal protective equipment during the coronavirus crisis. But Biden took the matter a step further on Thursday, describing his proposal as a “simple proposition” that “doesn’t have anything to do with Democrats, Republicans or independents.” Related:Trump has change of heart on face masks: ‘If you’re close together, I would put on the mask’ And see:This is the biggest mistake people make while wearing a face mask “It’s not about your rights. It’s about your responsibilities as an American,” Biden also said, as he appeared with his running mate, Sen. Kamala Harris of California. “Joe Biden is about leadership in our country,” she said.
